pages.text: Death in $(thing)Stranded Ashore$() is a punishing experience, especially if you die while out exploring. When you die, all of the items in your inventory will be dropped into the world as a $(item)totem of holding$(). This keeps them safe until you're able to return and get them back. $(thing)Left-clicking$() the $(item)totem$() will give a few of your items back each time.

$(l)Beware!$() If you die while your $(item)totem of holding$() still has items, all of the items will be dropped on the ground and left to despawn.$(2br)When playing in $(thing)multiplayer$(), only the person who died can claim their items back from the $(item)totem$(), so you can't send your friends on rescue missions unless you're with them too.
